alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 6:40PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong outflow winds ahead of weakening showers will impact portions of eastern Elbert and north central Lincoln Counties through 730 PM MDT... At 638 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong, gusty winds along a line extending from 6 miles north of Agate to near Ramah, or along a line extending from 22 miles northwest of Limon to 37 miles northeast of Colorado Springs. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree branches and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Limon, Simla, Genoa, Agate and Matheson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. The strong winds will occur far ahead of any showers or sprinkles.
